title: Unable to use Theano as backend
body:
- [X] I'm up-to-date with the latest release:
    
      pip install -U talos

- [X] I've confirmed that my Keras model works outside of Talos.

The scan_round.py tries to clear the graph session assuming that I am using TensorFlow. Is there a work around for this?

Gist link for the keras model I used- https://gist.github.com/shakkeel1330/8b1ed785dcd0a1356ab59cf6831fc3f1

Error trace: 

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-907839f7c8d5> in <module>
     19 }
     20 
---> 21 automation_script.run_imly(dataset_info, 'linear_discrimant_analysis', X, Y, 0.60, params=params)

~\Desktop\MLSquare\cook-imly\imly\automation_script.py in run_imly(dataset_info, model_name, X, Y, test_size, **kwargs)
    150     x_train = x_train.values  # Talos accepts only numpy arrays
    151     m = dope(base_model, params=kwargs['params'])
--> 152     m.fit(x_train, y_train)
    153     keras_score = m.score(x_test, y_test)
    154 

~\Desktop\MLSquare\cook-imly\imly\wrappers\sklearn\keras_classifier.py in fit(self, x_train, y_train, **kwargs)
     37                                                                        params=self.params,
     38                                                                        val_metric=self.val_metric,
---> 39                                                                        metric=self.metric) 
     40             self.model.fit(x_train, y_train, epochs=final_epoch,
     41                            batch_size=final_batch_size, verbose=0)

~\Desktop\MLSquare\cook-imly\imly\optimizers\talos\talos.py in get_best_model(x_train, y_train, **kwargs)
     27                 experiment_no=experiment_no,
     28                 model=talos_model,
---> 29                 grid_downsample=0.5)
     30 
     31     report = h.data

~\Anaconda2\envs\py36\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\Scan.py in __init__(self, x, y, params, model, dataset_name, experiment_no, x_val, y_val, val_split, shuffle, round_limit, grid_downsample, random_method, seed, search_method, reduction_method, reduction_interval, reduction_window, reduction_threshold, reduction_metric, reduce_loss, last_epoch_value, clear_tf_session, disable_progress_bar, print_params, debug)
    161         # input parameters section ends
    162 
--> 163         self._null = self.runtime()
    164 
    165     def runtime(self):

~\Anaconda2\envs\py36\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\Scan.py in runtime(self)
    166 
    167         self = scan_prepare(self)
--> 168         self = scan_run(self)

~\Anaconda2\envs\py36\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\scan_run.py in scan_run(self)
     18                      disable=self.disable_progress_bar)
     19     while len(self.param_log) != 0:
---> 20         self = scan_round(self)
     21         self.pbar.update(1)
     22     self.pbar.close()

~\Anaconda2\envs\py36\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\scan_round.py in scan_round(self)
     73     # clear tensorflow sessions (maybe)
     74     if self.clear_tf_session is True:
---> 75         K.clear_session()
     76     self.round_counter += 1
     77 

AttributeError: module 'keras.backend' has no attribute 'clear_session'

```


-------------------------------------------------------------------------
